---
title: "git_ssh_auth_invalid_missing_password.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines storage settings for a Git repository using SSH authentication. However, it contains an invalid configuration due to a missing password field, which is typically required for SSH key-based authentication.

## Symbols

### `storage`
#### Description
The root configuration block that defines the storage settings for the application.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the storage type as "git"
- Contains a nested `git` block with repository and authentication details

### `storage.type`
#### Description
Specifies the type of storage to be used.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The storage type, set to "git" |

### `storage.git`
#### Description
Contains the configuration details for Git repository access.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the repository URL
- Includes an `authentication` block for SSH authentication details

### `storage.git.repository`
#### Description
Defines the URL of the Git repository to be accessed.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| repository | string | The SSH URL of the Git repository |

### `storage.git.authentication`
#### Description
Specifies the authentication method and details for accessing the Git repository.

#### Internal Logic
- Contains an `ssh` block with user and private key information

### `storage.git.authentication.ssh`
#### Description
Defines the SSH authentication details for Git repository access.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the SSH user
- Provides the path to the private key file
- Missing the required password field, making this configuration invalid

### `storage.git.authentication.ssh.user`
#### Description
Specifies the username for SSH authentication.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| user | string | The SSH username |

### `storage.git.authentication.ssh.private_key_path`
#### Description
Specifies the file path to the SSH private key.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| private_key_path | string | The file path to the SSH private key |

## Error Handling
This configuration file is intentionally invalid due to the missing `password` field in the SSH authentication block. In a real-world scenario, this would likely result in an authentication failure when attempting to connect to the Git repository.

## TODOs
- Add the missing `password` field to the `storage.git.authentication.ssh` block to make the configuration valid for SSH key-based authentication.
